<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/07/tensions-continue-rise-us-china-president-trump-issues-executive-orders?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
President Trump vs. Chinese Apps
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Anchorman GIF" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/ToMjGpjpXMFPshSYGLm/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Anchorman GIF" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/ToMjGpjpXMFPshSYGLm/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Late on Thursday, President Trump issued <a href="https://edition.cnn.com/2020/08/06/politics/trump-executive-order-tiktok/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">executive orders</a> threatening to ban the popular Chinese apps TikTok and WeChat in the U.S. in the next 45 days. While we have written <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/31/president-trump-expected-order-bytedance-divest-stake-tiktok?email=mr-dunk@sbcglobal.net&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">lots</a> <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/03/chinese-government-citizens-attack-proposed-tiktok-sale?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">of</a> <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/02/microsoft-tiktok-thrown-off-trumps-pledge-ban-app?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">words</a> about what a TikTok ban (and rumored acquisition by Microsoft) would mean, Trump’s attack on WeChat has a potentially more disruptive ripple effect.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">First, what is WeChat?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s a messaging app with over 1 billion users owned by Tencent, one of the largest companies in China. But, similar to other Chinese apps like <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/20/chinas-ant-group-eyes-huge-ipo?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Alipay</a>, WeChat has morphed into a “super app” crammed with all sorts of extra features that allow users to transfer money and shop online, in addition to sending messages. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>It’s also a popular way for users in the U.S. to </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/07/trump-banning-wechat-would-be-devastating-blow-to-some-chinese-families.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">communicate</a></span><span> with friends and family back in China, given that other U.S. messaging apps are banned by the Chinese government. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Apple isn’t going bananas for a ban</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The world’s largest company does 20% of its iPhone sales in China, but the executive order would force it to pull WeChat from its App Store. Here's the problem: When Chinese consumers were asked if they would rather give up their iPhones or WeChat, they voted to <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-08-07/trump-s-wechat-ban-could-hurt-iphone-sales-in-china?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">keep WeChat</a> by a margin of 20-to-1, Bloomberg reports.  </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>If a ban goes through, former iPhone users could turn to Chinese tech giant Huawei for their next phone, benefitting another Chinese company President Trump has tried to constrain. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Experts are still trying to decode the language of the order, which left many things open-ended. So we don't know yet the <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-wechat-trump-china/u-s-businesses-in-china-face-uncertainty-as-white-house-bans-wechat-idUSKCN25320Z?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">potential consequences</a> for the many U.S. companies—along with Apple—that operate in China. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>The Trump administration continues to warn of the <a href="https://www.cnet.com/news/trump-effectively-bans-tiktok-wechat-with-executive-orders/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">security risks</a> posed by Chinese firms scraping data from American consumers. Banning WeChat would be *cough* an unprecedented escalation of the U.S. and China’s “tech cold war.” </p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/07/economy-adds-18-million-jobs-unemployment-ticks-102?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
A Report on the Jobs Report
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The U.S. added 1.8 million jobs in July while the unemployment rate ticked down to 10.2%, the Labor Dept. said yesterday in its monthly jobs report. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s progress. Despite the COVID-19 outbreak across the South and West last month, employers continued to extend offer letters, though not at the rate they did in May or June. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">There is one concerning trend. </strong>More people are going without a job for longer periods. 6.5 million workers have been unemployed for 15–26 weeks, <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/covid-19-pandemic-triggers-wave-of-long-term-unemployment-11596817137?mod=hp_lead_pos5&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">up 4.6 million</a> from last month.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Why’s that a big deal? Economists say the longer you go without a job, the <a href="https://www.marketplace.org/2020/08/07/how-will-employers-perceive-long-term-unemployment-covid19/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">less likely</a> you are to land a new one.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Work isn’t like riding a bicycle. As months go by, in-demand skills change, and your proficiency in a certain software might not be the asset it once was. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>the recovery has a <a href="https://apnews.com/e0aca194f0f4870b01280049ca567a87?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">long way to go</a>. The economy has only added back 42% of the jobs it lost during the pandemic, and any full rebound is dependent on solving the health crisis first.</p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
EDUCATION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/07/ny-governor-andrew-cuomo-says-schools-can-reopen-inperson-classes?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
New York Goes Back to School
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Simpsons characters texting in class" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=378 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/W1VdPHo8Ft3Es/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Simpsons characters texting in class" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/W1VdPHo8Ft3Es/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo said he’ll <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/08/07/nyregion/cuomo-schools-reopening.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">allow schools</a> in the state to open for in-person instruction this fall. That includes New York City, the onetime epicenter of the coronavirus, and the largest school district in the country. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-08-07/cuomo-says-all-school-districts-in-n-y-can-re-open?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">decision</a> makes Cuomo a rebel with a cause. Major cities including Los Angeles, Houston, Chicago, San Diego, San Francisco, and Atlanta are all opting to start the year with virtual classes.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Cuomo cited New York’s low positive test rate as a reason for reopening schools.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The order doesn’t mandate that schools reopen across the state, just that they’re allowed to. Local officials will need to put a plan together if they want to move forward with in-person classes. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The economic angle: </strong>Work and virtual school go together like <em>Chopped </em>contestants and trying to make ice cream in the dessert round. The issue is especially pronounced among low-income parents, who are less likely to be able to work from home or have the tech tools for online education. In an NYC Dept. of Education survey, 75% of parents said they want their kids to go back to school. </p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s rare that legendary investors and cofounders of The Motley Fool, <a href="https://www.fool.com/mms/mark/all-in-advert?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=contentmarketing&utm_campaign=sar-allinalert&aid=9223&paid=9223&waid=9223&source=esamnbwdg0210106&psource=esamnbwdg0210106&wsource=esamnbwdg0210106" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">David and Tom Gardner</a>, formally agree on the exact same stock–it’s only happened 26 times over the entire history of <a href="https://www.fool.com/mms/mark/all-in-advert?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=contentmarketing&utm_campaign=sar-allinalert&aid=9223&paid=9223&waid=9223&source=esamnbwdg0210106&psource=esamnbwdg0210106&wsource=esamnbwdg0210106" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Motley Fool Stock Advisor.</a></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Actually, make that 27. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Because these captains of investment have come to agreement once again, and history has taught us that <a href="https://www.fool.com/mms/mark/all-in-advert?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=contentmarketing&utm_campaign=sar-allinalert&aid=9223&paid=9223&waid=9223&source=esamnbwdg0210106&psource=esamnbwdg0210106&wsource=esamnbwdg0210106" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">big things can happen</a> when these two think alike.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Here’s a quick refresher on the results from some of the other times Dave and Tom chose the same stock: </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Netflix is up 17,608% </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Tesla is up 4,564% </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Amazon is up 20,226%</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">In fact, across the 26 stocks David and Tom have agreed on, the average return (as of 8/6/20) is 931%.</strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Dave and Tom won’t let us spill the beans on this “all in,” under-the-radar stock, so you’ll just have to <a href="https://www.fool.com/mms/mark/all-in-advert?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=contentmarketing&utm_campaign=sar-allinalert&aid=9223&paid=9223&waid=9223&source=esamnbwdg0210106&psource=esamnbwdg0210106&wsource=esamnbwdg0210106" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sign up for Stock Advisor and find out for yourselves</a>. </p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPORTS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/07/lot-sports-tv-right-now?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
So. Many. Sports.
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Tiger woods hitting a golf shot" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMDE1L3RpZ2VyX3dvb2RzX2hpdHRpbmdfYV9nb2xmX3Nob3QuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Yep, that's Tiger hitting driver on a 336-yard Par 4. Eagle city (photo by Ezra Shaw/Getty Images)</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">After weeks (years?) of no sports, there are suddenly more balls and pucks flying around than airplanes. Here is everything that’s been going on in the sports world:</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Golf: </strong>The PGA Championship, golf’s first major of the year, is currently underway in San Francisco. The Brew's pick? Watch out for Tommy Fleetwood. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">NHL:</strong> Hockey's resumed play with a <a href="https://www.espn.com/nhl/story/_/id/29610644/nhl-playoffs-daily-2020-reckoning-day?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">24-team tournament</a> in fanless arenas in Toronto and Edmonton and it’s been wacky. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">NBA: </strong>The NBA has had <a href="https://www.espn.com/nba/story/_/id/29601861/nba-extends-streak-spotless-covid-19-testing-orlando?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">zero players</a> test positive for COVID-19 since entering the famous "bubble" in Orlando. And without spectators, players are <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/nba-bubble-shooting-soccer-empty-stadiums-11596539693?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">shooting lights out</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">MLB: </strong>After the St. Louis Cardinals and the Miami Marlins experienced serious <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/08/06/sports/baseball/mlb-safety-protocols.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">coronavirus outbreaks</a>, the league released updated safety regulations...and the shortened season soldiers on.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">MLS:</strong> Commissioner Don Garber has discussed the possibility of <a href="https://www.espn.com/soccer/major-league-soccer/story/4154223/mls-commissioner-don-garber-games-to-have-fans-where-we-can?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">resuming regular-season games with fans</a> after a successful "MLS is Back" tournament. Orlando City will take on the Portland Timbers in the final next Tuesday.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Without any $$ from ticket sales, leagues are banking on TV viewership to drive revenue. So far, the results are <a href="https://www.forbes.com/sites/maurybrown/2020/08/06/early-regional-sports-network-tv-ratings-and-ad-sales-for-mlb-are-up-compared-to-2019/#40ef43373441?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">promising</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"></p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INFORMATION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/07/stats-wikipedia-covid19?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
No Rest for the Wiki
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Washington Post has an <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2020/08/07/wikipedia-covid-coronavirus/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">interesting writeup</a> of how Wikipedia is dealing with COVID-19. A few stats:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>As of the end of July, there were 5,000 Wikipedia articles about COVID-19 and its impacts written by more than 67,000 editors across 175 different languages.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The main English </span><span><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coronavirus_disease_2019?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">COVID-19 article</a></span><span> had more than 4,000 editors and 22,000 total edits. It received more than 73 million page views as of July 30.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> Experts told the WaPo that Wikipedia's process actually does a much better job of limiting the spread of misinformation than Facebook or Twitter. Time to fire off a strongly worded email to our eighth-grade English teacher. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"></p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SATURDAY HEADLINES
</h3>
</td>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Pretty sure we did a food-themed Saturday Headlines a few weeks ago, but food headlines are truly the gift that keeps on giving. Three of these nutritious headlines are real while one is as synthetic as “Red Dye<strong style="color:#000"> </strong>40.” See if your sensitive news palette can spot the fake. </p>
<ol style="list-style-type: lower-alpha;">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>"A Taiwanese airline is </span><span><a href="https://www.insider.com/eva-air-hello-kitty-themed-fathers-day-flight-2020-8?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">hosting a 'Hello Kitty'-themed flight</a></span><span> to nowhere, and it includes a Michelin-star meal"</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">

style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eGiphy\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLate on Thursday, President Trump issued \u003ca href=\"https://edition.cnn.com/2020/08/06/politics/trump-executive-order-tiktok/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eexecutive orders\u003c/a\u003e threatening to ban the popular Chinese apps TikTok and WeChat in the U.S. in the next 45 days. While we have written \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/31/president-trump-expected-order-bytedance-divest-stake-tiktok?email=mr-dunk@sbcglobal.net\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elots\u003c/a\u003e \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/03/chinese-government-citizens-attack-proposed-tiktok-sale?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eof\u003c/a\u003e \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/02/microsoft-tiktok-thrown-off-trumps-pledge-ban-app?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewords\u003c/a\u003e about what a TikTok ban (and rumored acquisition by Microsoft) would mean, Trump’s attack on WeChat has a potentially more disruptive ripple effect.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eFirst, what is WeChat?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt’s a messaging app with over 1 billion users owned by Tencent, one of the largest companies in China. But, similar to other Chinese apps like \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/20/chinas-ant-group-eyes-huge-ipo?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eAlipay\u003c/a\u003e, WeChat has morphed into a “super app” crammed with all sorts of extra features that allow users to transfer money and shop online, in addition to sending messages. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIt’s also a popular way for users in the U.S. to \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/07/trump-banning-wechat-would-be-devastating-blow-to-some-chinese-families.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecommunicate\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e with friends and family back in China, given that other U.S. messaging apps are banned by the Chinese government. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eApple isn’t going bananas for a ban\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe world’s largest company does 20% of its iPhone sales in China, but the executive order would force it to pull WeChat from its App Store. Here's the problem: When Chinese consumers were asked if they would rather give up their iPhones or WeChat, they voted to \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-08-07/trump-s-wechat-ban-could-hurt-iphone-sales-in-china?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ekeep WeChat\u003c/a\u003e by a margin of 20-to-1, Bloomberg reports.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIf a ban goes through, former iPhone users could turn to Chinese tech giant Huawei for their next phone, benefitting another Chinese company President Trump has tried to constrain. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eExperts are still trying to decode the language of the order, which left many things open-ended. So we don't know yet the \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-wechat-trump-china/u-s-businesses-in-china-face-uncertainty-as-white-house-bans-wechat-idUSKCN25320Z?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epotential consequences\u003c/a\u003e for the many U.S. companies—along with Apple—that operate in China. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eThe Trump administration continues to warn of the \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnet.com/news/trump-effectively-bans-tiktok-wechat-with-executive-orders/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esecurity risks\u003c/a\u003e posed by Chinese firms scraping data from American consumers. Banning WeChat would be *cough* an unprecedented escalation of the U.S. and China’s “tech cold war.” \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nA Report on the Jobs Report\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe U.S. added 1.8 million jobs in July while the unemployment rate ticked down to 10.2%, the Labor Dept. said yesterday in its monthly jobs report. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt’s progress. Despite the COVID-19 outbreak across the South and West last month, employers continued to extend offer letters, though not at the rate they did in May or June. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThere is one concerning trend. \u003c/strong\u003eMore people are going without a job for longer periods. 6.5 million workers have been unemployed for 15–26 weeks, \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/covid-19-pandemic-triggers-wave-of-long-term-unemployment-11596817137?mod=hp_lead_pos5\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eup 4.6 million\u003c/a\u003e from last month.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhy’s that a big deal? Economists say the longer you go without a job, the \u003ca href=\"https://www.marketplace.org/2020/08/07/how-will-employers-perceive-long-term-unemployment-covid19/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eless likely\u003c/a\u003e you are to land a new one.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWork isn’t like riding a bicycle. As months go by, in-demand skills change, and your proficiency in a certain software might not be the asset it once was. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ethe recovery has a \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/e0aca194f0f4870b01280049ca567a87?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elong way to go\u003c/a\u003e. The economy has only added back 42% of the jobs it lost during the pandemic, and any full rebound is dependent on solving the health crisis first.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo said he’ll \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/08/07/nyregion/cuomo-schools-reopening.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eallow schools\u003c/a\u003e in the state to open for in-person instruction this fall. That includes New York City, the onetime epicenter of the coronavirus, and the largest school district in the country. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-08-07/cuomo-says-all-school-districts-in-n-y-can-re-open?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edecision\u003c/a\u003e makes Cuomo a rebel with a cause. Major cities including Los Angeles, Houston, Chicago, San Diego, San Francisco, and Atlanta are all opting to start the year with virtual classes.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eCuomo cited New York’s low positive test rate as a reason for reopening schools.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe order doesn’t mandate that schools reopen across the state, just that they’re allowed to. Local officials will need to put a plan together if they want to move forward with in-person classes. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe economic angle: \u003c/strong\u003eWork and virtual school go together like \u003cem\u003eChopped \u003c/em\u003econtestants and trying to make ice cream in the dessert round. The issue is especially pronounced among low-income parents, who are less likely to be able to work from home or have the tech tools for online education. In an NYC Dept. of Education survey, 75% of parents said they want their kids to go back to school. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" Eagle city (photo by Ezra Shaw/Getty Images)\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAfter weeks (years?) of no sports, there are suddenly more balls and pucks flying around than airplanes. Here is everything that’s been going on in the sports world:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eGolf: \u003c/strong\u003eThe PGA Championship, golf’s first major of the year, is currently underway in San Francisco. The Brew's pick? Watch out for Tommy Fleetwood. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eNHL:\u003c/strong\u003e Hockey's resumed play with a \u003ca href=\"https://www.espn.com/nhl/story/_/id/29610644/nhl-playoffs-daily-2020-reckoning-day?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e24-team tournament\u003c/a\u003e in fanless arenas in Toronto and Edmonton and it’s been wacky. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eNBA: \u003c/strong\u003eThe NBA has had \u003ca href=\"https://www.espn.com/nba/story/_/id/29601861/nba-extends-streak-spotless-covid-19-testing-orlando?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ezero players\u003c/a\u003e test positive for COVID-19 since entering the famous \"bubble\" in Orlando. And without spectators, players are \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/nba-bubble-shooting-soccer-empty-stadiums-11596539693?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eshooting lights out\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMLB: \u003c/strong\u003eAfter the St. Louis Cardinals and the Miami Marlins experienced serious \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/08/06/sports/baseball/mlb-safety-protocols.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecoronavirus outbreaks\u003c/a\u003e, the league released updated safety regulations...and the shortened season soldiers on.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMLS:\u003c/strong\u003e Commissioner Don Garber has discussed the possibility of \u003ca href=\"https://www.espn.com/soccer/major-league-soccer/story/4154223/mls-commissioner-don-garber-games-to-have-fans-where-we-can?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eresuming regular-season games with fans\u003c/a\u003e after a successful \"MLS is Back\" tournament. Orlando City will take on the Portland Timbers in the final next Tuesday.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eWithout any $$ from ticket sales, leagues are banking on TV viewership to drive revenue. target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epromising\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp A few stats:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAs of the end of July, there were 5,000 Wikipedia articles about COVID-19 and its impacts written by more than 67,000 editors across 175 different languages.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe main English \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coronavirus_disease_2019?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eCOVID-19 article\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e had more than 4,000 editors and 22,000 total edits. It received more than 73 million page views as of July 30.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line:\u003c/strong\u003e Experts told the WaPo that Wikipedia's process actually does a much better job of limiting the spread of misinformation than Facebook or Twitter.
